definition: to collaborate/to join forces/to effect a junction
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: At long last all our forces were reunited.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有的部队终于会师了。

sentences.english: The two met at Teano, a little north of Naples.
sentences.chinese: 两支队伍在那不勒斯稍北的泰阿诺会师。

sentences.english: They finally succeeded in joining the two forces.
sentences.chinese: 他们最终成功地使两支军队会师了。

sentences.english: Our advance troops married up with partisans pressing down from the hills.
sentences.chinese: 我们先遣部队跟山上下来的游击队员们会师了。

sentences.english: Beyond that bridge was the linkup point with units from the 29th Division coming from Omaha.
sentences.chinese: 此桥过去就是与奥马哈登陆之第29师会师地。

definition: to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to move troops to/(fig.) to move to/to shift to
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
